result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Attorney  Ryan Drengler in court for Defendant Audrey M Faivre. Prosecuting Atty Daniel R. Hess appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Audrey M Faivre appeared by phone. Attorney  Daniel R. Hess in court for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin. Cases 13CM559, 15CM432, and 15CM15, and 5 Uncharged Read Ins. 
  Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
 Defendant is in voluntary treatment.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

State has complied with victim notification.
Defendant enters a plea of: 
13CM559

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 13CM559.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

15CM432 and 15CM15 are dismissed and read in.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 15, 2017 at 10:15 am.

Pre-trial conference on October 2, 2017 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Audrey M. Faivre appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty Cass W Cousins appeared for State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard at this time are 15CM-15, 13CM-559 and 15CM-432.

11:56 AM Court calls cases.
Atty Cousins states appearances.

Atty Cousins addresses the Court, Defendant failed to appear at the plea/sentencing hearing in January 2016.

Court questions Defendant as to non appearance.
Defendant replies. 
Defendant returned to Wisconsin about a week ago. 

Atty Cousins addresses the Court regarding bond.

BY THE COURT:
Court orders $1,000 cash bond, covers all 3 files.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 2, 2017 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Audrey M. Faivre in court with attorney Anne Renc. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard at this time are 13CM-559 and 15CM-15.

8:52 AM Court calls cases.
This is a motion to modify bond.
Atty Constable states appearances.

Atty Constable does not object to the motion.

Court reviews the motion, for Defendant to move out of state.

Atty Renc addresses the Court, reviewed the bonds, requests pretrial supervision and day report language be removed.

BY THE COURT:
Pretrial supervision program and day reporting will be vacated from the bond.
and Notice of Motion
Status conference at 08-17-2015 10:30 am
Defendant Record Update
Pre-trial conference at 06-29-2015 10:30 am
Status conference on June 8, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Report alcohol and drug free to the Day Report Center no less than the following times per week:  * 2 times per week

Defendant Audrey M Faivre in court with attorney Anne Renc. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard: 13CM559, 15CM15

9:08 a.m.  Court calls the cases. 
Atty Constable makes statements to the Court.  Defense will not object to her motion.  Moves the court with regards to both files to modify the bonds in both cases to require her to report to day report 2 times per week. 
Atty Renc concurs.  Understands matters will be rescheduled for another date. 
Court questions the defendant. 
Defendant concurs. 

BY THE COURT:  Court grants the motion.  Termination of VIP in 13CM559 is ordered.  In accordance with the agreement made, Court modifies the bond to add day report 2 days per week while these matters remain pending.  All other conditions remain.  Status conference scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 09:00 am.
